trans-unit.source: A new collection can be created under the database by executing an HTTPS POST request against the URI resource path <legacyItalic><legacyBold>colls</legacyBold></legacyItalic>.
trans-unit.target: A new collection can be created under the database by executing an HTTPS POST request against the URI resource path <legacyItalic><legacyBold>colls</legacyBold></legacyItalic>.

trans-unit.source: Note that the {databaseaccount} is the name of the DocumentDB account created under your subscription.
trans-unit.target: Note that the {databaseaccount} is the name of the DocumentDB account created under your subscription.

trans-unit.source: The {_rid-db} value is the resource ID of the database where the collection will be created.
trans-unit.target: The {_rid-db} value is the resource ID of the database where the collection will be created.

trans-unit.source: The authentication type and signature token.
trans-unit.target: The authentication type and signature token.

trans-unit.source: Only the master Key token is allowed for this operation.
trans-unit.target: Only the master Key token is allowed for this operation.

trans-unit.source: For more information, see <legacyLink xlink:href="c3c3324c-9a3f-4cad-8a74-bd73d8b4e40b" xmlns:xlink="http://www.w3.org/1999/xlink">Access Control on DocumentDB Resources</legacyLink>.
trans-unit.target: For more information, see <legacyLink xlink:href="c3c3324c-9a3f-4cad-8a74-bd73d8b4e40b" xmlns:xlink="http://www.w3.org/1999/xlink">Access Control on DocumentDB Resources</legacyLink>.

trans-unit.source: For creating a database, the <legacyBold>Content-Type</legacyBold> header must be application/json.
trans-unit.target: For creating a database, the <legacyBold>Content-Type</legacyBold> header must be application/json.

trans-unit.source: The client user agent performing the request.
trans-unit.target: The client user agent performing the request.

trans-unit.source: The recommended format is {user agent name}/{version}.
trans-unit.target: The recommended format is {user agent name}/{version}.

trans-unit.source: For example, the DocumentDB .NET SDK sets the <legacyBold>User-Agent</legacyBold> string to <token>azure_doccli_ver</token>.
trans-unit.target: For example, the DocumentDB .NET SDK sets the <legacyBold>User-Agent</legacyBold> string to <token>azure_doccli_ver</token>.

trans-unit.source: The date of the request, per RFC 1123.
trans-unit.target: The date of the request, per RFC 1123.

trans-unit.source: The date is expressed in Coordinated Universal Time format, e.g. Fri, 08 Apr 2015 03:52:31 GMT.
trans-unit.target: The date is expressed in Coordinated Universal Time format, e.g. Fri, 08 Apr 2015 03:52:31 GMT.

trans-unit.source: The version of the DocumentDB REST service.
trans-unit.target: The version of the DocumentDB REST service.

trans-unit.source: The latest version is used when the header is not provided.
trans-unit.target: The latest version is used when the header is not provided.

trans-unit.source: For more information, see <legacyLink xlink:href="f174cfcb-644c-4006-a5e9-2ad30c39b38a" xmlns:xlink="http://www.w3.org/1999/xlink">Versioning for DocumentDB REST API</legacyLink>.
trans-unit.target: For more information, see <legacyLink xlink:href="f174cfcb-644c-4006-a5e9-2ad30c39b38a" xmlns:xlink="http://www.w3.org/1999/xlink">Versioning for DocumentDB REST API</legacyLink>.

trans-unit.source: The user generated unique name for the collection.
trans-unit.target: The user generated unique name for the collection.

trans-unit.source: No two collections can have the same ids.
trans-unit.target: No two collections can have the same ids.

trans-unit.source: This is a string that must not be more than 255 characters.
trans-unit.target: This is a string that must not be more than 255 characters.

trans-unit.source: This value is used to configure indexing policy.
trans-unit.target: This value is used to configure indexing policy.

trans-unit.source: By default, the indexing is automatic for all document paths within the collection.
trans-unit.target: By default, the indexing is automatic for all document paths within the collection.

trans-unit.source: This sample request creates a new collection called ArtCollection with the default indexing policy.
trans-unit.target: This sample request creates a new collection called ArtCollection with the default indexing policy.

trans-unit.source: This operation returns the following common headers.
trans-unit.target: This operation returns the following common headers.

trans-unit.source: There may be additional standard and common headers returned.
trans-unit.target: There may be additional standard and common headers returned.

trans-unit.source: DocumentDB always returns the response body in standard JSON format.
trans-unit.target: DocumentDB always returns the response body in standard JSON format.

trans-unit.source: This etag carries the same value as the _etag value returned as part of the response body.
trans-unit.target: This etag carries the same value as the _etag value returned as part of the response body.

trans-unit.source: The date-time of the response operation.
trans-unit.target: The date-time of the response operation.

trans-unit.source: This date time format conforms to the RFC 1123 date time format expressed in Coordinated Universal Time.
trans-unit.target: This date time format conforms to the RFC 1123 date time format expressed in Coordinated Universal Time.

trans-unit.source: For this operation, the header shows the allotted quotas for document size, functions, stored procedures and triggers in a collection.
trans-unit.target: For this operation, the header shows the allotted quotas for document size, functions, stored procedures and triggers in a collection.

trans-unit.source: For more information on limits and quotas, see <externalLink><linkText>DocumentDB limits</linkText><linkUri>http://azure.microsoft.com/documentation/articles/documentdb-limits/</linkUri></externalLink>.
trans-unit.target: For more information on limits and quotas, see <externalLink><linkText>DocumentDB limits</linkText><linkUri>http://azure.microsoft.com/documentation/articles/documentdb-limits/</linkUri></externalLink>.

trans-unit.source: For this operation, the header shows the current usage quotas, document size, functions, stored procedures and triggers in the collection.
trans-unit.target: For this operation, the header shows the current usage quotas, document size, functions, stored procedures and triggers in the collection.

trans-unit.source: This is The number of request units (RU) consumed by the operation.
trans-unit.target: This is The number of request units (RU) consumed by the operation.

trans-unit.source: For more information about request units, see <externalLink><linkText>Manage DocumentDB capacity and performance</linkText><linkUri>http://azure.microsoft.com/documentation/articles/documentdb-manage/</linkUri></externalLink>.
trans-unit.target: For more information about request units, see <externalLink><linkText>Manage DocumentDB capacity and performance</linkText><linkUri>http://azure.microsoft.com/documentation/articles/documentdb-manage/</linkUri></externalLink>.

trans-unit.source: This is the unique identifier for the operation.
trans-unit.target: This is the unique identifier for the operation.

trans-unit.source: It is used for trouble-shooting purposes.
trans-unit.target: It is used for trouble-shooting purposes.

trans-unit.source: This is the unique name that identifies the new collection.
trans-unit.target: This is the unique name that identifies the new collection.

trans-unit.source: This is a system generated property.
trans-unit.target: This is a system generated property.

trans-unit.source: The resource ID (_rid) is a unique identifier that is also hierarchical per the resource stack on the resource model.
trans-unit.target: The resource ID (_rid) is a unique identifier that is also hierarchical per the resource stack on the resource model.

trans-unit.source: It is used internally for placement and navigation of the permission resource.
trans-unit.target: It is used internally for placement and navigation of the permission resource.

trans-unit.source: This is a system generated property.
trans-unit.target: This is a system generated property.

trans-unit.source: It denotes the last updated timestamp of the resource.
trans-unit.target: It denotes the last updated timestamp of the resource.

trans-unit.source: This is a system generated property.
trans-unit.target: This is a system generated property.

trans-unit.source: It is the unique addressable URI for the resource.
trans-unit.target: It is the unique addressable URI for the resource.

trans-unit.source: This is a system generated property that specifies the resource etag required for optimistic concurrency control.
trans-unit.target: This is a system generated property that specifies the resource etag required for optimistic concurrency control.

trans-unit.source: This is a system generated property that specifies the addressable path of the documents resource.
trans-unit.target: This is a system generated property that specifies the addressable path of the documents resource.

trans-unit.source: This is a system generated property that specifies the addressable path of the stored procedures (sprocs) resource.
trans-unit.target: This is a system generated property that specifies the addressable path of the stored procedures (sprocs) resource.

trans-unit.source: This is a system generated property that specifies the addressable path of the triggers resource.
trans-unit.target: This is a system generated property that specifies the addressable path of the triggers resource.

trans-unit.source: This is a system generated property that specifies the addressable path of the user-defined functions (udfs) resource.
trans-unit.target: This is a system generated property that specifies the addressable path of the user-defined functions (udfs) resource.

trans-unit.source: This is a system generated property that specifies the addressable path of the conflicts resource.
trans-unit.target: This is a system generated property that specifies the addressable path of the conflicts resource.

trans-unit.source: During an operation on a resource within a collection, if a conflict occurs, users can inspect the conflicting resources by performing a GET on the conflicts URI path.
trans-unit.target: During an operation on a resource within a collection, if a conflict occurs, users can inspect the conflicting resources by performing a GET on the conflicts URI path.

trans-unit.source: This is the indexing policy settings for collection.
trans-unit.target: This is the indexing policy settings for collection.

trans-unit.source: Indicates whether automatic indexing is on or off.
trans-unit.target: Indicates whether automatic indexing is on or off.

trans-unit.source: The default value is <parameterReference>True</parameterReference> thus all documents are indexed.
trans-unit.target: The default value is <parameterReference>True</parameterReference> thus all documents are indexed.

trans-unit.source: Setting the value to <parameterReference>False</parameterReference> would allow manual configuration of indexing paths.
trans-unit.target: Setting the value to <parameterReference>False</parameterReference> would allow manual configuration of indexing paths.

trans-unit.source: By default, the indexing mode is <parameterReference>Consistent</parameterReference>.
trans-unit.target: By default, the indexing mode is <parameterReference>Consistent</parameterReference>.

trans-unit.source: This means indexing occurs synchronously during insertion, replacement, or deletion of documents.
trans-unit.target: This means indexing occurs synchronously during insertion, replacement, or deletion of documents.

trans-unit.source: To have indexing occur asynchronously, set the indexing mode to <parameterReference>lazy</parameterReference>.
trans-unit.target: To have indexing occur asynchronously, set the indexing mode to <parameterReference>lazy</parameterReference>.

trans-unit.source: The array containing the document paths to be indexed.
trans-unit.target: The array containing the document paths to be indexed.

trans-unit.source: By default, two paths are included: the <parameterReference>/</parameterReference> path, that indicates that all document paths be indexed, and the <parameterReference>_ts</parameterReference> path, that indicates indexing for timestamp range comparison.
trans-unit.target: By default, two paths are included: the <parameterReference>/</parameterReference> path, that indicates that all document paths be indexed, and the <parameterReference>_ts</parameterReference> path, that indicates indexing for timestamp range comparison.

trans-unit.source: <parameterReference>Hash</parameterReference> indexes are useful for equality comparisons while <parameterReference>Range</parameterReference> indexes are useful for range comparison.
trans-unit.target: <parameterReference>Hash</parameterReference> indexes are useful for equality comparisons while <parameterReference>Range</parameterReference> indexes are useful for range comparison.

trans-unit.source: At the moment, <parameterReference>Range</parameterReference> indexes can only be used for numeric values.
trans-unit.target: At the moment, <parameterReference>Range</parameterReference> indexes can only be used for numeric values.

trans-unit.source: The default value is <parameterReference>Hash</parameterReference> for document paths and <parameterReference>Range</parameterReference> for _ts paths.
trans-unit.target: The default value is <parameterReference>Hash</parameterReference> for document paths and <parameterReference>Range</parameterReference> for _ts paths.

trans-unit.source: This is the byte precision value for numeric values.
trans-unit.target: This is the byte precision value for numeric values.

trans-unit.source: The higher the value the lower the probability of term collision, which results in faster and more accurate comparisons.
trans-unit.target: The higher the value the lower the probability of term collision, which results in faster and more accurate comparisons.

trans-unit.source: However, the higher the value the greater the storage overhead.
trans-unit.target: However, the higher the value the greater the storage overhead.

trans-unit.source: This is the byte precision value for strings.
trans-unit.target: This is the byte precision value for strings.

trans-unit.source: The higher the value the lower the probability of term collision resulting in faster and more accurate comparisons.
trans-unit.target: The higher the value the lower the probability of term collision resulting in faster and more accurate comparisons.

trans-unit.source: However, the higher the value the greater the storage overhead.
trans-unit.target: However, the higher the value the greater the storage overhead.

trans-unit.source: The document path to be indexed.
trans-unit.target: The document path to be indexed.

trans-unit.source: The accepted value is a valid document path including wildcards value such as ?
trans-unit.target: The accepted value is a valid document path including wildcards value such as ?

trans-unit.source: The array containing the document paths to be excluded from indexing.
trans-unit.target: The array containing the document paths to be excluded from indexing.

trans-unit.source: The accepted value is a valid document path including wildcard values such as ?
trans-unit.target: The accepted value is a valid document path including wildcard values such as ?

trans-unit.source: The following table lists common status codes returned by this operation.
trans-unit.target: The following table lists common status codes returned by this operation.

trans-unit.source: For information related to error status codes, see <legacyLink xlink:href="7104e4ef-fa51-4194-93f0-bb5f53fe9d61" xmlns:xlink="http://www.w3.org/1999/xlink">HTTP Status Codes</legacyLink>.
trans-unit.target: For information related to error status codes, see <legacyLink xlink:href="7104e4ef-fa51-4194-93f0-bb5f53fe9d61" xmlns:xlink="http://www.w3.org/1999/xlink">HTTP Status Codes</legacyLink>.

trans-unit.source: Check for missing curly brackets or quotes.
trans-unit.target: Check for missing curly brackets or quotes.

trans-unit.source: The <legacyBold>Authorization</legacyBold> or <legacyBold>x-ms-date</legacyBold> header is not set.
trans-unit.target: The <legacyBold>Authorization</legacyBold> or <legacyBold>x-ms-date</legacyBold> header is not set.

trans-unit.source: 401 is also returned when the <legacyBold>Authorization</legacyBold> header is set to an invalid authorization token.
trans-unit.target: 401 is also returned when the <legacyBold>Authorization</legacyBold> header is set to an invalid authorization token.

trans-unit.source: For more information on authorization tokens, see <legacyLink xlink:href="c3c3324c-9a3f-4cad-8a74-bd73d8b4e40b" xmlns:xlink="http://www.w3.org/1999/xlink">Access Control on DocumentDB Resources</legacyLink>.
trans-unit.target: For more information on authorization tokens, see <legacyLink xlink:href="c3c3324c-9a3f-4cad-8a74-bd73d8b4e40b" xmlns:xlink="http://www.w3.org/1999/xlink">Access Control on DocumentDB Resources</legacyLink>.

trans-unit.source: 403 is also returned by this operation when the number of collections in the database has reached its allowable quota.
trans-unit.target: 403 is also returned by this operation when the number of collections in the database has reached its allowable quota.

trans-unit.source: For more information on limits and quotas, see <externalLink><linkText>DocumentDB limits</linkText><linkUri>http://azure.microsoft.com/documentation/articles/documentdb-limits/</linkUri></externalLink>.
trans-unit.target: For more information on limits and quotas, see <externalLink><linkText>DocumentDB limits</linkText><linkUri>http://azure.microsoft.com/documentation/articles/documentdb-limits/</linkUri></externalLink>.

trans-unit.source: The <legacyBold>id</legacyBold> provided for the new collection has been taken by an existing collection.
trans-unit.target: The <legacyBold>id</legacyBold> provided for the new collection has been taken by an existing collection.

trans-unit.source: This sample response shows that the default indexing policy being used; all document paths in the collection will be hash-indexed with the numeric and string precisions set to 3 respectively.
trans-unit.target: This sample response shows that the default indexing policy being used; all document paths in the collection will be hash-indexed with the numeric and string precisions set to 3 respectively.

trans-unit.source: In addition, the _ts path is range-indexed with its numeric precision set to 6.
trans-unit.target: In addition, the _ts path is range-indexed with its numeric precision set to 6.

trans-unit.source: The index mode is set to consistent which means that indexing will occur synchronously as documents in the collection are inserted, replaced, and deleted.
trans-unit.target: The index mode is set to consistent which means that indexing will occur synchronously as documents in the collection are inserted, replaced, and deleted.

trans-unit.source: There are no paths being excluded from the index.
trans-unit.target: There are no paths being excluded from the index.
